attribute.name: Median List Price Per Sq Ft

liveshere.title: Affluent Immigrants
liveshere.name: High-income immigrants living in suburban areas.
liveshere.description: Ranging in age from mid-30s to early 60s, these highly educated immigrants earn high salaries. A high proportion are homeowners.

liveshere.title: Stretching Couples
liveshere.name: High-income, high- expense suburban couples.
liveshere.description: These married couples without children earn handsome salaries, but have significantly higher mortgages than the national average. Most own their homes, and some have a college education.

liveshere.title: Leave It to Beaver
liveshere.name: Middle- to upper-income suburban families.
liveshere.description: Ranging in age from 30s to 50s, these married couples with children are likely to own their home and work in management, professional, or skill-based occupations. Education level varies from high school to college.

liveshere.title: Multi-lingual Suburbanites
liveshere.name: Middle-class, suburban individuals who speak a foreign language.
liveshere.description: Age ranges from 30s to 60s. Some own their homes. Education varies from high school to college, with some earning graduate school degrees.

liveshere.title: Country Clubbers
liveshere.name: Wealthy married couples with children.
liveshere.description: These affluent families live a very comfortable life in the suburbs. More than 20% have a family income over $125,000. Most have earned a college or graduate school degree, and most own their homes.

category.characteristic: Work in office and administrative support occupations

attribute.name: Median List Price Per Sq Ft

liveshere.title: Non-native Newbies
liveshere.name: Foreign-born individuals who just moved to U.S.
liveshere.description: A significant proportion of people who have moved to the U.S. from Puerto Rico, the U.S. Island Areas, or a foreign country. Wide age range. Some have a high school or college education, and they work in a variety of occupations.

liveshere.title: Foreign-born Urbanites
liveshere.name: Foreign-born individuals who live in city.
liveshere.description: Born outside the U.S., they have moved to the U.S. and live in the city. Wide age range. Some have a high school or college education, and they work in a variety of occupations.

liveshere.title: Makin' It Singles
liveshere.name: Upper-scale urban singles.
liveshere.description: Pre-middle-age to middle-age singles with upper-scale incomes. May or may not own their own home. Most have college educations and are employed in mid-management professions.

liveshere.title: Multi-lingual Urbanites
liveshere.name: Urban dwellers who speak more than one language.
liveshere.description: Some have a high school or college education, and they work in a variety of occupations. Moderate to upper-scale earning potential.

liveshere.title: Aspiring Urbanites
liveshere.name: Urban singles with moderate income.
liveshere.description: Low- to middle-income singles over a wide age range. Some have a college education. They work in a variety of occupations, including some management-level positions.

Work in office and administrative support occupations
Work in sales and related occupations

attribute.name: Median List Price Per Sq Ft

liveshere.title: Frugal Families
liveshere.name: Lower-income families living in the suburbs.
liveshere.description: Middle-income married couples with children, ranging in age from upper 30s to upper 50s. Some are high school graduates, while others have completed college. Occupations vary.

liveshere.title: New Suburbanites
liveshere.name: Mobile suburban singles.
liveshere.description: A high proportion of these pre-middle-age to middle-age singles have moved to the suburbs in the past 4 years. Some have a college education and work in professional or management careers.

liveshere.title: College Life
liveshere.name: Students in higher education. These individuals are enrolled in college or graduate school.
liveshere.description: People in college or graduate school.

liveshere.title: Upwardly Mobile
liveshere.name: Suburban couples living in mobile homes.
liveshere.description: A higher than average percentage of these married couples with no children live in mobile homes or non-conventional homes (boats, RVs, etc.). Education level varies from high school to college.

liveshere.title: Suburban Climbers
liveshere.name: Younger suburban singles.
liveshere.description: Aspiring singles climbing the corporate ladder and calling the suburbs home. Age ranges from mid-20s to mid-40s. Most rent their homes.

liveshere.title: Rat Racers
liveshere.name: Dual-income suburban families.
liveshere.description: These married couples with children lead very busy lives, with most bringing in two paychecks per household. Education level varies from high school to college.

liveshere.title: Affluent DINKs
liveshere.name: High-income, kid-free couples living in the suburbs.
liveshere.description: Middle-age Dual Income No Kids couple bringing in two attractive incomes. Most are highly educated and are employed in management professions. A high proportion are homeowners.

liveshere.title: Green Mile
liveshere.name: People in correctional institutions. These individuals are confined to prisons, penitentiaries, or correctional facilities.
liveshere.description: People in correctional institutions.

liveshere.title: Wide Open Foyers
liveshere.name: Suburban families living in large houses.
liveshere.description: These well-off married couples with children own their own homes, and the homes are bigger than average. Age ranges from the mid-30s to the upper 50s. Most are highly educated professionals, many with advanced degrees.

liveshere.title: Suburban Trailblazers
liveshere.name: Younger suburban immigrants.
liveshere.description: Foreign-language-speaking individuals earning lower to middle incomes. Education level varies from high school to college. Some own their homes, while others rent.

category.characteristic: Work in construction and extraction occupations

attribute.name: Median List Price Per Sq Ft

liveshere.title: Foreign-born Urbanites
liveshere.name: Foreign-born individuals who live in city.
liveshere.description: Born outside the U.S., they have moved to the U.S. and live in the city. Wide age range. Some have a high school or college education, and they work in a variety of occupations.

liveshere.title: Urban Bootstrappers
liveshere.name: Lower-scale single parents living in the city.
liveshere.description: Single parents who support themselves and their children on a low income. A high proportion are female. Most have a high school education or lower, and most rent their homes.

liveshere.title: One-income Metros
liveshere.name: Single-income families living in the city.
liveshere.description: Families with adults approaching middle age with one partner working and the other a stay-at-home parent. Mixed educational status with some having a high school education and some college.

liveshere.title: Multi-lingual Urbanites
liveshere.name: Urban dwellers who speak more than one language.
liveshere.description: Some have a high school or college education, and they work in a variety of occupations. Moderate to upper-scale earning potential.

liveshere.title: Aspiring Urbanites
liveshere.name: Urban singles with moderate income.
liveshere.description: Low- to middle-income singles over a wide age range. Some have a college education. They work in a variety of occupations, including some management-level positions.
